QAPair.Question: What is (are) Vacuum-assisted delivery ?
QAPair.Answer: During vacuum assisted vaginal delivery, the doctor or midwife will use a vacuum (also called a vacuum extractor) to help move the baby through the birth canal. The vacuum extractor uses a soft plastic cup that attaches to the baby's head with suction. The doctor or midwife uses a handle on the cup to move the baby through the birth canal.
